    • Method Detail

      • verifyEquals

        public static void verifyEquals(Object expectedValue,
                                Object actualValue,
                                Verifications.VerificationComparisonType verificationComparisonType,
                                Verifications.VerificationType verificationType)
        Verifies that two strings are equal if VerificationType is POSITIVE, or not equal if VerificationType is NEGATIVE.
        Parameters:
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
        actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this verification
        verificationComparisonType - VerificationComparisonType.LITERAL, CONTAINS, REGEX, CASE_INSENSITIVE
        verificationType - VerificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

      • verifyEquals

        public static void verifyEquals(Object expectedValue,
                                Object actualValue,
                                int comparisonType,
                                Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies that two strings are equal if VerificationType is true, or not equal if VerificationType is false.

        This method will be removed soon. Use verifyEquals(Object , Object , VerificationComparisonType , VerificationType) instead.

        Parameters:
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
        actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this verification
        comparisonType - 1 is literalComparison, 2 is regexComparison, 3 is containsComparison, 4 is caseInsensitiveComparison
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive verification that the objects are equal, or 'false' for a negative verification that the objects are not equal

      • verifyNull

        public static void verifyNull(Object object,
                              Verifications.VerificationType verificationType)
        Verifies that object is null if VerificationType is POSITIVE, or not equal if VerificationType is NEGATIVE.
        Parameters:
        object - the object under test
        verificationType - VerificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

      • verifyNull

        public static void verifyNull(Object object,
                              Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies that object is null if VerificationType is true, or not equal if VerificationType is false.

        This method will be removed soon. Use verifyNull(Object , VerificationType) instead.

        Parameters:
        object - the object under test
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive verification that the object refers to null, or 'false' for a negative verification that the object doesn't refer to null

                                       Verifications.VerificationType verificationType)

        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        verificationType - VerificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

      • verifyElementExists

        public static void verifyElementExists(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                       org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                       Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies that webElement exists if VerificationType is true, or does not exist if VerificationType is false.

        This method will be removed soon. Use verifyElementExists(WebDriver , By , VerificationType) instead.

        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive verification that the element exists, or 'false' for a negative verification that the element doesn't exist

      • verifyElementAttribute

        public static void verifyElementAttribute(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                          org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                          String elementAttribute,
                                          String expectedValue,
                                          Verifications.VerificationComparisonType verificationComparisonType,
                                          Verifications.VerificationType verificationType)
        Verifies that webElement attribute equals expectedValue if verificationType is POSITIVE, or does not equal expectedValue if verificationType is NEGATIVE.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        elementAttribute - the desired attribute of the webElement under test
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
        verificationComparisonType - VerificationComparisonType.LITERAL, CONTAINS, REGEX, CASE_INSENSITIVE
        verificationType - VerificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE expected value

      • verifyElementAttribute

        public static void verifyElementAttribute(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                          org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                          String elementAttribute,
                                          String expectedValue,
                                          int comparisonType,
                                          Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies that webElement attribute equals expectedValue if verificationType is true, or does not equal expectedValue if verificationType is false.

        This method will be removed soon. Use verifyElementAttribute(WebDriver , By , String, String, VerificationComparisonType , VerificationType) instead.

        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        elementAttribute - the desired attribute of the webElement under test
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
        comparisonType - 1 is literalComparison, 2 is regexComparison, 3 is containsComparison, 4 is caseInsensitiveComparison
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive verification that the element attribute actual value matches the expected value, or 'false' for a negative verification that the element attribute actual value doesn't match the expected value

      • verifyElementCSSProperty

        public static void verifyElementCSSProperty(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                            org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                            String propertyName,
                                            String expectedValue,
                                            Verifications.VerificationComparisonType verificationComparisonType,
                                            Verifications.VerificationType verificationType)
        Verifies webElement CSSProperty equals expectedValue if verificationType is POSITIVE, or does not equal expectedValue if verificationType is NEGATIVE.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        propertyName - the target CSS property of the webElement under test
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
        verificationComparisonType - VerificationComparisonType.LITERAL, CONTAINS, REGEX, CASE_INSENSITIVE
        verificationType - VerificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE expected value

      • verifyElementCSSProperty

        public static void verifyElementCSSProperty(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                            org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                            String propertyName,
                                            String expectedValue,
                                            int comparisonType,
                                            Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies webElement CSSProperty equals expectedValue if verificationType is true, or does not equal expectedValue if verificationType is false.

        This method will be removed soon. Use verifyElementCSSProperty(WebDriver , By , String, String, VerificationComparisonType , VerificationType) instead.

        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        propertyName - the target CSS property of the webElement under test
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
        comparisonType - 1 is literalComparison, 2 is regexComparison, 3 is containsComparison, 4 is caseInsensitiveComparison
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive assertion that the element CSSProperty actual value matches the expected value, or 'false' for a negative assertion that the element CSSProperty actual value doesn't match the expected value

      • verifyBrowserAttribute

        public static void verifyBrowserAttribute(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                          String browserAttribute,
                                          String expectedValue,
                                          Verifications.VerificationComparisonType verificationComparisonType,
                                          Verifications.VerificationType verificationType)
        Verifies that browser attribute equals expectedValue if verificationType is POSITIVE, or does not equal expectedValue if verificationType is NEGATIVE.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        browserAttribute - the desired attribute of the browser window under test
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
        verificationComparisonType - VerificationComparisonType.LITERAL, CONTAINS, REGEX, CASE_INSENSITIVE
        verificationType - VerificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE expected value

      • verifyBrowserAttribute

        public static void verifyBrowserAttribute(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                          String browserAttribute,
                                          String expectedValue,
                                          int comparisonType,
                                          Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies that browser attribute equals expectedValue if verificationType is true, or does not equal expectedValue if verificationType is false.

        This method will be removed soon. Use verifyBrowserAttribute(WebDriver , String, String, VerificationComparisonType , VerificationType) instead.

        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        browserAttribute - the desired attribute of the browser window under test
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
        comparisonType - 1 is literalComparison, 2 is regexComparison, 3 is containsComparison, 4 is caseInsensitiveComparison
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive verification that the browser attribute actual value matches the expected value, or 'false' for a negative verification that the browser attribute actual value doesn't match the expected value

      • verifyComparativeRelation

        public static void verifyComparativeRelation(Number expectedValue,
                                             Number actualValue,
                                             Verifications.ComparativeRelationType comparativeRelationType,
                                             Verifications.VerificationType verificationType)
        Verifies that the expectedValue is related to the actualValue using the desired comparativeRelationType if verificationType is POSITIVE, or not related if verificationType is NEGATIVE.
        Parameters:
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
        actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this assertion
        comparativeRelationType - assertComparativeRelation.GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUALS, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUALS, EQUALS
        verificationType - VerificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE expected value

      • verifyComparativeRelation

        public static void verifyComparativeRelation(Number expectedValue,
                                             Number actualValue,
                                             String comparativeRelationType,
                                             Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies that the expectedValue is related to the actualValue using the desired comparativeRelationType if verificationType is true, or not related if verificationType is false.

        This method will be removed soon. Use verifyComparativeRelation(Number , Number, ComparativeRelationType , VerificationType) instead.

        Parameters:
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
        actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this assertion
        comparativeRelationType - accepts standard java Equality, Relational, and Conditional Operators, except [not equal to]: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/op2.html
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive assertion that the expectedValue is related to the actualValue using the desired comparativeRelationType, or 'false' for a negative assertion that the expectedValue is not related to the actualValue using the desired comparativeRelationType

      • verifyFileExists

        public static void verifyFileExists(String fileFolderName,
                                    String fileName,
                                    int numberOfRetries,
                                    Verifications.VerificationType verificationType)
        Verifies that a certain file exists if verificationType is POSITIVE, or doesn't exist if verificationType is NEGATIVE.
        Parameters:
        fileFolderName - The location of the folder that contains the target file, relative to the project's root folder, ending with a /
        fileName - The name of the target file (including its extension if any)
        numberOfRetries - number of times to try to find the file, given that each retry is separated by a 500 millisecond wait time
        verificationType - VerificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE expected value

      • verifyFileExists

        public static void verifyFileExists(String fileFolderName,
                                    String fileName,
                                    int numberOfRetries,
                                    Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies that a certain file exists if verificationType is true, or doesn't exist if verificationType is false.

        This method will be removed soon. Use verifyFileExists(String , String, int , VerificationType) instead.

        Parameters:
        fileFolderName - The location of the folder that contains the target file, relative to the project's root folder, ending with a /
        fileName - The name of the target file (including its extension if any)
        numberOfRetries - number of times to try to find the file, given that each retry is separated by a 500 millisecond wait time
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive verification that the file exists, or 'false' for a negative assertion that the file doesn't exist

      • verifyTrue

        public static void verifyTrue(Boolean conditionalStatement,
                              Verifications.VerificationType verificationType)
        Verifies that the provided conditional statement evaluates to true if VerificationType is POSITIVE, or to false if VerificationType is NEGATIVE.
        Parameters:
        conditionalStatement - the statement that will be evaluated to see if it matches the expected result
        verificationType - VerificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

      • verifyJSONFileContent

        public static void verifyJSONFileContent(io.restassured.response.Response response,
                                         String referenceJsonFilePath,
                                         RestActions.ComparisonType comparisonType,
                                         Verifications.VerificationType verificationType)
        Verifies that the target API Response object matches the expected referenceJsonFile if VerificationType is POSITIVE, or doesn't match it if VerificationType is NEGATIVE.
        Parameters:
        response - the full response object returned by performRequest method.
        referenceJsonFilePath - the full absolute path to the test data file that will be used as a reference for this comparison
        comparisonType - ComparisonType.EQUALS, CONTAINS, MATCHES, EQUALS_STRICT; Note that MATCHES ignores the content ordering inside the JSON
        verificationType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

      • verifyJSONFileContent

        public static void verifyJSONFileContent(io.restassured.response.Response response,
                                         String referenceJsonFilePath,
                                         RestActions.ComparisonType comparisonType,
                                         String jsonPathToTargetArray,
                                         Verifications.VerificationType verificationType)
        Verifies that the target array extracted by parsing the API Response object matches the expected referenceJsonFile if VerificationType is POSITIVE, or doesn't match it if VerificationType is NEGATIVE.
        Parameters:
        response - the full response object returned by performRequest method.
        referenceJsonFilePath - the full absolute path to the test data file that will be used as a reference for this comparison
        comparisonType - ComparisonType.EQUALS, CONTAINS, MATCHES, EQUALS_STRICT; Note that MATCHES ignores the content ordering inside the JSON
        jsonPathToTargetArray - a jsonpath that will be parsed to point to the target JSON Array
        verificationType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE
